devdoc.details: Public functions calling external contracts do not guard against reentrancy because they are expected to be called via delegatecall, which will execute this contract's logic within the context of the originating contract. For example, the HubPool will delegatecall these functions, therefore it's only necessary that the HubPool's methods that call this contract's logic guard against reentrancy.

params._cctpMessageTransmitter: MessageTransmitter contract to bridge messages via CCTP.
params._cctpTokenMessenger: TokenMessenger contract to bridge tokens via CCTP.
params.solanaSpokePool: Solana spoke pool address, decoded from Base58 to bytes32.
params.solanaSpokePoolUsdcVault: USDC token address on Solana for the spoke pool, decoded from Base58 to bytes32.
params.solanaUsdc: USDC mint address on Solana, decoded from Base58 to bytes32.

relayMessage(address,bytes).details: Only allows sending messages to the Solana spoke pool.

params.target: Program on Solana (translated as EVM address) that will receive message.

relayTokens(address,address,uint256,addr.details: Only allows bridging USDC to Solana spoke pool.

params.amount: Amount of L1 tokens to deposit and L2 tokens to receive.

cctpMessageTransmitter().notice: The official Circle CCTP MessageTransmitter contract endpoint.

relayMessage(address,bytes).notice: Send cross-chain message to target on Solana.

userdoc.notice: Contract containing logic to send messages from L1 to Solana via CCTP.
